attributes.action: Use teacher-assessed grades instead of 'mini-exams' in Summer 2021
attributes.additional_details: Following the Cancellation of Exams, Students have been met with confusion and teachers had reduced the workload given that exams were 'cancelled' as announced on national television. Now more recently in Ofqual's consultation, it has been announced exam board set 'mini-exams' may take place, despite students learning from home and being away from school for an extended period of time because of the national lockdown. This alongside the unpreparedness of students, leaves some disadvantaged.
attributes.background: Instead of the currently proposed 'mini-exams' being used to collect data for the upcoming Summer 2021 exam series, teacher-assessed grades should be used without application of an algorithm.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Cancel GCSE and A-levels in 2021 replace with Course Work and Teacher Assessment: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/564696

Base 2021 GCSE and A-Level Grades on Teacher Considerations and Mock Grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553307

Give students the option to take exams or receive assessed grades for 2020/21: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559964

The Department for Education and Ofqual are consulting on the approach to awarding GCSE, AS and A level grades in 2021 following the cancellation of exams. You can find out more about this consultation here: https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/consultation-on-how-gcse-as-and-a-level-grades-should-be-awarded-in-summer-2021
